prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. The probability of snow for each of the next three days is $\frac{3}{4}$. What is the probability that it will not snow at all during the next three days? Express your answer as a common fraction.
solution: The probability of it snowing on any one day is $\frac{3}{4}$ so the probability of it not snowing on any one day is $\frac{1}{4}$. So, the probability it not snowing on all three days is $\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^3 = \boxed{\frac{1}{64}}$.
gpt_response:
If it snows 3 out of 4 days, that means it won't snow 1 out of 4 days. So if the probability of snow for each of the next three days is $\frac{3}{4}$, then the probability that it won't snow for each of the next three days is $\frac{1}{4}$. 

To find the probability that it won't snow at all during the next three days, we multiply the probability of each day not snowing together: $\frac{1}{4} \times \frac{1}{4} \times \frac{1}{4} = \frac{1}{64}$. 

So the probability that it will not snow at all during the next three days is $\boxed{\frac{1}{64}}$.
solution_prompt:

So if the probability of snow for each of the next three days is $\frac{3}{4}$, then the probability that it won't snow for each of the next three days is $\frac{1}{4}$. 

To find the probability that it won't snow at all during the next three days, we multiply the probability of each day not snowing together: $\frac{1}{4} \times \frac{1}{4} \times \frac{1}{4} = \frac{1}{64}$. 

So the probability that it will not snow at all during the next three days is $\boxed{\frac{1}{64}}$.
